title: torch.median memory leak in 0.3.1
body_html:
Issue description

  • torch.median has a memory leak on the GPU when using PyTorch version 0.3.1.
  • The memory leak goes away if I downgrade to PyTorch 0.3.0.
  • I was able to reproduce the memory leak on 3 separate machines using P100s, 1080TIs and Titan Xs.

Code example

import torch

while True: 
    X = torch.randn(100,100).cuda()
    torch.median(X,1)

System Info

  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • PyTorch version: 0.3.1.post3
  • Python version: 3.6.3
  • CUDA version: 8.0.61
  • GPU models and configuration: 4x P100s, 2x 1080 TIs, 4x Titan X (3 separate machines)

## Issue description

- `torch.median` has a memory leak on the GPU when using PyTorch version 0.3.1. 
- The memory leak goes away if I downgrade to PyTorch 0.3.0. 
- I was able to reproduce the memory leak on 3 separate machines using P100s, 1080TIs and Titan Xs. 

## Code example
```python
import torch

while True: 
    X = torch.randn(100,100).cuda()
    torch.median(X,1)
```

## System Info
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04
- PyTorch version: 0.3.1.post3
- Python version: 3.6.3
- CUDA version: 8.0.61
- GPU models and configuration: 4x P100s, 2x 1080 TIs, 4x Titan X (3 separate machines)
